text: Stinking Quarter Creek is a stream in the U.S. state of North Carolina. It is a tributary of Big Alamance Creek. According to tradition, the name "Stinking Quarter" arose from the putrid stench of carrion after a buffalo hunt. ==See also== *List of rivers of North Carolina ==References== Category:Bodies of water of Alamance County, North Carolina Category:Rivers of North Carolina
title: Stinking Quarter Creek
